comment: Equivalent of Axiom of Choice. This is useful for proving that there exists, for example, a sequence mapping natural numbers to members of a larger set ` B ` , where ` ph ` depends on ` x ` (the natural number) and ` y ` (to specify a member of ` B ` ). A stronger version of this theorem, ~ ac6s , allows ` B ` to be a proper class. (Contributed by NM, 18-Oct-1999.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 27-Aug-2015.)
